Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Gaegurin-3  (Gaegurin 3, GGN3, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: skin, Korean wrinkled frogRana rugosa, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active againstM. luteus (MIC 2.5 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 10 ug/ml), B. subtilis (MIC 10 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. dysentariae (MIC 25 ug/ml), P. putida (MIC 50 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 50 ug/ml) and E. coli (MIC 75 ug/ml). (MIC data provided by Chunfeng Wang). It also ruptured protozoan A. proteus at 25 ug/ml in a few minutes.Toxicity:  Poor hemolysis (1.2%) at 100 ug/ml. Updated 9/2017; 5/2020.
Literature Information.Author: Park JM, Jung J-E, Lee BJ.1994
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the skin of a Korean frog, Rana rugosa.
